document_title: Eye astigmatism: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_name: mat-loan-thi.json_3_Causes of eye astigmatism and risk factors
subsection_content:
Some people mistakenly believe that reading in low-light environments or sitting close to a TV will cause astigmatism or make astigmatism worse. However, most astigmatism appears on its own without doctors knowing why. Patients may have astigmatism due to:
Genetics: children whose parents have astigmatism will be more susceptible to astigmatism or it may also be because the eyelids put too much pressure on the cornea.; Eye injuries: can be caused by sports injuries, accidents and foreign objects in the eye. This condition causes pain, swelling, redness, and other symptoms. Some people see flashes of light or changes in vision. Severe eye injuries can cause permanent vision loss.; Keratoconus: occurs over time, when the normal circular curvature of the eye surface bulges outward like a cone.; Corneal degeneration; Complications after eye surgery.
Astigmatism is very common, 1 in 3 people have astigmatism.
